translation.en: [Connie] I, Constance Reid, take you, Clifford Chatterley,
translation.es: Yo, Constance Reid, te tomo a ti, Clifford Chatterley,

translation.en: to be my lawfully wedded husband,
to have and to hold from this day forward,
translation.es: para amarte y cuidarte a partir de hoy,

translation.en: for better and for worse,
translation.es: en la prosperidad y en la adversidad,

translation.en: for richer and for poorer,
translation.es: en la riqueza y en la pobreza,

translation.en: in sickness and in health.
translation.es: en la salud y en la enfermedad.

translation.en: -[Connie laughing] -[Hilda] How does it feel? -I don't know. Ask me tomorrow. -[Hilda laughs]
translation.es: - ¿Cómo se siente? - No sé. Pregúntame mañana.

translation.en: -[Hilda] You need to eat something. -I need to get out of this dress.
translation.es: - Debes comer algo. - Necesito quitarme el vestido.

translation.en: How do I look?
Well, I doubt Clifford will want to stay long at the reception.
translation.es: Dudo que Clifford quiera quedarse mucho tiempo en la fiesta.

translation.en: You don't think his mother would've approved?
translation.es: ¿Crees que su madre no lo aprobaría?

translation.en: Well, I'm not entirely sure I do.
translation.es: No sé bien si lo apruebo yo.

translation.en: Are we talking about the dress now, Hilda, -or the wedding? -[lips smacking]
translation.es: ¿Hablamos del vestido, Hilda, o de la boda?

translation.en: He goes back to the front in the morning. Imagine if we'd left it,
translation.es: Vuelve al frente mañana. Imagina si no nos casábamos,

translation.en: and then something terrible happened.
-Couldn't you have just had sex with him? -Hilda! Be serious.
translation.es: - ¿No podrían solo haber tenido sexo? - ¡Hilda! En serio.

translation.en: I am. It's much less commitment, and it's all Clifford will want anyway.
translation.es: Hablo en serio. Es mucho menos compromiso, y es lo único que quiere Clifford.

translation.en: Clifford's not like that.
You know him. He's kind and thoughtful.
translation.es: Lo conoces. Es amable y considerado.

translation.en: He makes me feel safe.
His family's more traditional than ours, I suppose,
translation.es: Su familia es más tradicional que la nuestra,

translation.en: but I think his own views are actually quite progressive.
translation.es: pero creo que él tiene ideas bastante progresistas.

translation.en: -[Hilda] Really? -Yes.
-Does he know about that German boy? -Yes. And he says it doesn't matter.
translation.es: - ¿Sabe lo del chico alemán? - Sí. Y dice que no le importa.

translation.en: It was before the war, so it doesn't count.
translation.es: Fue previo a la guerra, no cuenta.

translation.en: [Hilda] You don't need to convince me. I had my own German boy, remember?
translation.es: No necesitas convencerme. También salí con uno, ¿recuerdas?

translation.en: Well, mine's dead.
-[sighs] -You see, that's just it.
-What? -[sighs]
I don't want to see you get hurt again.
translation.es: No quiero verte sufrir de nuevo.

translation.en: You, uh… You open your
heart so easily.
Oh, Hilda!
-Clifford! -Hmm, reinforcements have arrived.
You read my mind.
[chuckles] I nearly drank yours on the way up.
-[Clifford] Cheers. -Cheers.
Well, what now? [Clifford] Our fathers are preparing their toasts.
Can we face them together?
[Clifford] Of course.
You look stunning, Con.
Thanks.
[Clifford] Are you ready?
-So, here's to Clifford and Connie… -[tapping on glass]
translation.es: Un brindis por Clifford y Connie,

translation.en: …our new hope for an heir to Wragby. [laughs]
translation.es: nuestra esperanza para dar un heredero a Wragby.

translation.en: [all] To Clifford and Connie.
Father, that's not just why we married.
translation.es: Padre, no nos casamos solo por eso.

translation.en: No, why else would a baronet get married?
translation.es: ¿Por qué otra cosa se casaría un baronet?

translation.en: -I married because I found Connie. -And I you.
translation.es: - Me casé porque encontré a Connie. - Y yo a ti.

translation.en: We would like to thank those who donated their butter and sugar rations
translation.es: Gracias a quienes donaron sus raciones de mantequilla y azúcar

translation.en: to help us celebrate.
To the next heir of Chatterley.
translation.es: Por el futuro heredero de Chatterley.

translation.en: -[guests] To the Chatterleys! -[glasses clinking]
Oh God. "Why else is a baronet ever married?"
translation.es: Cielos. "¿Por qué otra cosa se casaría un baronet?".

translation.en: Unbelievable. [scoffs]
Do you want children, Clifford?
Uh, yeah. Yeah, someday.
-For our sake, not for my father's. -Hmm.
translation.es: Por nosotros, no por mi padre.

translation.en: Assuming you would.
I think so, yes.
What? You all right? Yes, um, of course. Sorry. Uh…
It's just, um…
I can't stop thinking about going back to the front.
translation.es: Me preocupa mi vuelta al frente.

translation.en: -I… I know I'll be all right. -You will be.
translation.es: - Sé que estaré bien. - Lo estarás.

translation.en: -We don't have to do anything. -No, no, I… I want to.
translation.es: - No hace falta hacer nada. - Quiero hacerlo.

translation.en: Sure you don't want me to come to the station?
translation.es: ¿No deseas que vaya a la estación?

translation.en: [Clifford] Thanks.
Let's not make a ceremony of it, shall we?
translation.es: pero no lo convirtamos en una ceremonia.

translation.en: I love you, Con.
Bye.
I look forward to your letters.
I'll write to you every day.
[Connie] Dearest Hilda, I knew the war would change us all,
translation.es: Querida Hilda: Sabía que la guerra nos cambiaría a todos,

translation.en: but I just wasn't sure how much.
It feels as though it ended half a lifetime ago,
not just half a year.
We've already moved away from London.
We've just arrived at Wragby,
Clifford's family estate.
Once we're settled in, I expect to write to you often.
translation.es: Te escribiré más seguido cuando nos instalemos.

translation.en: Your loving sister, Connie.
translation.es: Tu hermana que te quiere, Connie.

translation.en: [Connie] Thank you.
[Mrs. Warren] Welcome home, Sir Clifford. We've been praying for you.
translation.es: Bienvenido a casa, sir Clifford. Hemos orado por usted.

translation.en: Thank you, Mr. Warren.
There's the one
[Connie] All right.
Thank you. I can, uh… I can manage.
Mr. and Mrs. Warren, this is my wife,
translation.es: Sr. y Sra. Warren, les presento a mi esposa,

translation.en: the new Lady Chatterley.
It's so nice to meet you, milady.
There's plenty of work to be done.
Hire back all the workers we can, Mrs. Warren.
translation.es: Contrate a los trabajadores que podamos.

translation.en: Old girl's seen better days. [Connie chuckles] We'll bring her back to life.
translation.es: - La pobre tuvo días mejores. - La reviviremos.

translation.en: We thought you might like to use your father's study as the master bedroom,
translation.es: Creímos que preferiría el estudio de su padre como dormitorio

translation.en: so you don't have to bother with the stairs.
[chuckles] Thank you, Mrs. Warren.
No, let's put the luggage in here.
We'll use the library as a master.
What is more inspiring for a writer than to sleep among books?
translation.es: ¿Qué más inspirador para un escritor que dormir aquí?

translation.en: This is where they found Father. They say his heart gave out.
translation.es: Aquí hallaron a mi padre. Dicen que le falló el corazón.

translation.en: I think he died of chagrin.
Clifford… it's all done now.
Life is what we make of it. [chuckles]
translation.es: La vida es lo que hacemos con ella.

translation.en: -Mrs. Warren. -Yes.
Let's open the curtains, let some light in.
translation.es: Abramos las cortinas, que entre luz.

translation.en: [Mrs. Warren] Of course, milady.
-[Clifford] We should have a look around. -I will.
You're welcome to use the private room above the library
translation.es: Puedes usar el cuarto de aquí arriba,

translation.en: with the family portraits.
You can have the whole of the second floor.
translation.es: Puedes usar todo el segundo piso.

translation.en: Welcome home, Clifford.
You all right? I've got you. Lean on me, put your weight on me.
translation.es: ¿Estás bien? Te sostengo. Apoya el peso sobre mí.

translation.en: -[Clifford grunts] Ready? -Mm-hmm. Yes. [exclaims]
I'm getting the hang of it. [sighs]
-Love it. -Mmm.
[Clifford sighs] You know, um…
I'm thinking of expanding the short story I wrote in Cambridge.
translation.es: Creo que extenderé el cuento que escribí en Cambridge.

translation.en: -Hmm? -Turning it into a novel.
-It's a wonderful idea. -You think?
-You'll be my editor? -Of course.
Proofreader, typist. I'll submit my application.
translation.es: Correctora, mecanógrafa. Te enviaré la solicitud.

translation.en: I'll get you to the top of the pile.
translation.es: Te pondré arriba de la pila.

translation.en: -All right? -Yes.
-Ooh, this bed is softer than I thought. -[both chuckle]
translation.es: Es más blanda de lo que creí.

translation.en: -First night at Wragby. Hmm. -Welcome.
-Oh, sorry. -Oh, you're fine. Really.
translation.es: - Perdón. - No hay problema. En serio.

translation.en: What?
I'm sorry, Con.
I just can't anymore, you know?
I'm so sorry.
It's all right. Don't worry.
You'll be fine?
Yes.
[whispering] I love you, Con.
This is misfortune, but you'll see.
translation.es: Es algo trágico, pero ya verás

translation.en: We… We'll be happy here
at Wragby.
Hello, sir.
I'm a strong, hardworking man, and I will not let you down.
translation.es: Soy fuerte y trabajador, no se arrepentirá.

translation.en: Lily Wheedon. My mum worked for Sir Geoffrey.
translation.es: Lily Wheedon. Mi mamá trabajaba para sir Geoffrey.

translation.en: Really?
Oliver Mellors?
You, uh, worked for my father before the war.
translation.es: Trabajó para mi padre antes de la guerra.

translation.en: Aye, sir.
-And you were an army lieutenant. -I was, sir.
translation.es: - Y fue teniente del ejército. - Así es, sir.

translation.en: Do you honestly believe that a return to gamekeeping
translation.es: ¿En serio cree que le resultará grato volver

translation.en: will be satisfying after your time as an officer?
translation.es: a cuidar la finca luego de ser oficial?

translation.en: Bit of quiet'd do me good.
translation.es: Me hará bien un poco de paz.

translation.en: -I've seen enough of what war does to men. -[Clifford] Hmm.
translation.es: Ya me cansé de lo que hace la guerra.

translation.en: As have I.
You must know your way around the estate better than I do.
translation.es: Debe conocer la finca mejor que yo.

translation.en: [Lily] Oh, no, milady. I couldn't visit while she was working.
translation.es: No, milady. No podía visitarla mientras trabajaba.

translation.en: Very well then. Welcome back, Mr. Mellors.
translation.es: Muy bien. Bienvenido de vuelta, señor Mellors.

translation.en: [Oliver] Sir.
[Connie] In that case, we'll have to learn our way around together. Won't we?
translation.es: En ese caso, tendremos que aprender juntas.

translation.en: -[Lily] Hmm. -Thank you, Lily.
My name is Kelly Martin, milady.
-Thank you. -I've been a maid for five years.
[Connie] Dear Hilda,
I'm a thoughtless lout for not writing sooner.
In my defense, Wragby needed an enormous amount of tending to.
translation.es: En mi defensa diré que Wragby requirió mucha atención.

translation.en: But we finally have a full staff who've done wonders in restoring the place.
translation.es: Al fin, con todo el personal, se obraron milagros restaurando el lugar.

translation.en: Clifford's strength has returned.
I'm still the only one he's willing to let help him,
translation.es: Aún soy la única de quien acepta ayuda,

translation.en: but every day, he can do more and more on his own.
translation.es: pero cada día hace más cosas solo.

translation.en: He's writing, all the time,
which keeps his spirits up, and he's nearly finished his first novel.
translation.es: eso mantiene alta su moral, y ya casi finalizó su primera novela.

translation.en: [Clifford] "I first met Mrs. Gertrude at a dinner, comma,
translation.es: "Conocí a la señora Gertrude en una cena, coma,

translation.en: -thrown by Lord Witherby." -[typewriter clacking]
Witherby, W-I-T-H-E-R-B-Y.
translation.es: Witherby, W- I- T- H- E- R- B- Y.

translation.en: "With the sort of fellow, whom--" I'm quite pleased with this…
translation.es: "Con el tipo de persona…". Me gusta esta…

translation.en: -"The sort of fellow…" -[Connie] It is quiet here in the country.
translation.es: La vida en el campo es tranquila.

translation.en: I miss the life we had in London,
and, of course, I miss you.
translation.es: y, claro, te extraño a ti.

translation.en: But we have to live, I suppose,
no matter how many skies have fallen.
translation.es: a pesar de todo lo sufrido.

translation.en: [Connie] We have had some guests.
Mostly Clifford's old bachelor friends.
translation.es: Sobre todo, amigos solteros de él.

translation.en: It's hardly surprising that most of them haven't found women, believe me.
translation.es: No me extraña que la mayoría no haya conseguido mujer, créeme.

translation.en: Now and again, we also get visits from writers
whose advice Clifford has sought out.
Apparently, my old friends all seem to think misfortune is contagious.
translation.es: Para mis viejas amistades, la desgracia debe ser contagiosa.

translation.en: I know you and Owen
have been traveling everywhere since the war ended,
translation.es: han viajado mucho desde el fin de la guerra,

translation.en: but once you've settled back home, I would so love to see you.
translation.es: pero cuando se instalen, me encantaría visitarlos.

translation.en: -Am I interrupting? -[Clifford] No, not at all.
I was thinking about going to London for a few days
translation.es: Estaba pensando en ir unos días a Londres,

translation.en: to visit Hilda.
Leaving me to fend for myself?
translation.es: ¿Me dejas a la buena de Dios?

translation.en: [chuckles] We do have a house full of servants.
translation.es: La casa está llena de criados.

translation.en: I don't need servants. I need you.
translation.es: Te necesito a ti, no a ellos.

translation.en: Why don't you invite Hilda? She'd be more than welcome.
translation.es: ¿Por qué no la invitas? Es más que bienvenida.

translation.en: I have. She can't get away from London for a few weeks.
translation.es: Lo hice. No puede ausentarse de Londres por unas semanas.

translation.en: Hmm. I'm glad at least she can come.
I'm going to go for a walk.
[Clifford] Why? We can send Mrs. Warren out for anything you might need.
translation.es: ¿Para qué? La Sra. Warren te traerá lo que necesites.

translation.en: I don't need anything, Clifford. I just want to go for a walk.
translation.es: No necesito nada, Clifford. Solo quiero dar un paseo.

translation.en: Very well, dear.
-As you like. -Jesus.
-[whistling nearby] -Hello.
[Oliver] Flossie! Come here, lass.
[Oliver] Come on.
Good girl. Good girl.
I wandered further down and I found this stream running right through the woods.
translation.es: Caminé cuesta abajo y encontré un arroyo que atravesaba el bosque.

translation.en: [grunts] I, uh, think I know the place. Doubt I'd be able to get there anymore.
translation.es: Creo que conozco el lugar. Dudo que pueda volver a ir.

translation.en: I'm sure we can find a way if you wanted to go.
translation.es: Si quieres ir, hallaremos la forma.

translation.en: -Right. -Perhaps.
Here we are.
-Ready? -Yes.
All right.
[groans] It's fine.
-It's all right? -Yes.
Uh, I don't want you to drop me.
I'm not going to drop you.
Look, just, um…
There we go.
There we are. That's fine. Just let me go there.
translation.es: Ya está. Está bien. Déjame a mí.

translation.en: Thank you. Thank you.
[grunts] Ah. There. -See, you didn't need my help at all. -[panting, chuckles]
translation.es: - Eso. - ¿Ves? No necesitabas mi ayuda para nada.

translation.en: -There must be times you hate me for this. -No.
I wouldn't blame you.
There are days I wish I hadn't made it back.
translation.es: Hay días que desearía no haber vuelto.

translation.en: Don't talk like that.
I'd be lost without you, Con. You know that.
translation.es: Estaría perdido sin ti. Lo sabes.

translation.en: Let's open some windows, get some fresh air in here.
translation.es: Abramos las ventanas, que entre aire fresco.

translation.en: I've never seen the sky so clear.
translation.es: Nunca vi el cielo tan diáfano.

translation.en: Yes, well, there's no smoke in the air. Mines are closed for May Day.
translation.es: No hay humo. Las minas cerraron por el Primero de Mayo.

translation.en: You should go down to Tevershall.
See the fair. You can, you know?
Just be back in time for tea.
translation.es: Vuelve a la hora del té.

translation.en: -Yes, I might. -Hmm.
-[man] Nice to see you, Lady Chatterley. -[woman] Milady.
It's nice to meet you, Lady Chatterley.
Oh, that's so kind.
Thank you.
Happy May Day to you, milady.
Happy May Day.
Who's this? She's precious.
-This is my Josephine. -Hi, Josephine.
Say hello to Lady Chatterley.
I seem to be having that effect on people today.
translation.es: Creo que hoy provoco eso en la gente.

translation.en: I'm Mrs. Flint. I'm a schoolteacher here in the village.
translation.es: Soy la señora Flint. Soy maestra de la escuela.

translation.en: I'm Connie. Lovely to meet you.
My, uh… My husband leases Marehay Farm from your estate.
translation.es: Mi esposo les arrienda la Granja Marehay.

translation.en: -Marehay Farm? -It's not far from where you are.
[chanting] Side by side we fight forever. More in numbers makes them stop.
translation.es: Codo a codo siempre lucharemos. Si somos muchos, los pararemos.

translation.en: Just as long as we stand together.
What was that?
[Mrs. Flint] The miners. They're out protesting again.
translation.es: Los mineros. Están protestando de nuevo.

translation.en: -Again? -[woman 1] Leave him!
Um, that, um… That happens a lot?
They must've been from one of the other mines.
They'd lose their jobs if they marched like that through their own village.
translation.es: Perderían sus trabajos si marcharan así en su pueblo.

translation.en: Does it mean our miners from Tevershall protest in other villages?
translation.es: ¿O sea que los mineros de Tevershall protestan en otros pueblos?

translation.en: I wouldn't know.
I may teach their children,
but I'm an outsider when it comes to the miners' wives.
translation.es: pero soy una extraña para sus esposas.

translation.en: That makes two of us.
-[woman 2] Well, hello, Lady Chatterley. -Hello.
[Mrs. Flint] You should come to Marehay one day.
-We'd love to have you. -I'd love that.
Thank you.
Where are we going?
You've always wanted me to join you on one of your walks.
I thought of somewhere I'd like to show you.
-Don't think your chair was made for this. -[chuckles]
translation.es: Tu silla no fue hecha para esto.

translation.en: Ah, Mellors. Give us a hand trying to get this chair started again.
translation.es: Mellors. ¿Nos daría una mano para desatascar la silla?

translation.en: Yes, sir.
Uh, Connie, have you met Mellors, our new gamekeeper?
Get down, you, Floss.
She's just being friendly. [chuckles]
Now, then.
You've been at Wragby sometime, Mr. Mellors?
I was raised here, Your Ladyship.
[Connie] Need some help?
[grunts] Mellors is quite capable of pushing on his own. There we are.
translation.es: Mellors puede empujarla solo. Ahí vamos.

translation.en: -Now… Now, now. -[grunts]
Nothing else, sir?
Nothing else. Good day.
[Connie] That was kind of you. Hope it wasn't too heavy.
translation.es: Muy amable de su parte. Ojalá no haya sido muy pesado.

translation.en: No, not heavy.
Good day to you, Your Ladyship.
[Clifford] I used to come here as a lad, sit for hours. One of the finest views in all the Midlands.
translation.es: De niño, pasaba horas aquí. Una gran vista de las Tierras Medias.

translation.en: I want to restore these woods.
If these places aren't preserved, there'll be no England left.
translation.es: Si arruinamos sitios así, será el fin de Inglaterra

translation.en: Our way of life will end, never mind what we gave up to defend it.
translation.es: y nuestras costumbres, da igual cómo la hayamos defendido.

translation.en: I mind not being able to have a son here more than any other place.
translation.es: Me preocupa no poder tener un hijo, sobre todo aquí.

translation.en: I'm sorry we can't have one.
Almost be a good thing if you had a son by another man.
translation.es: Sería bueno que tuvieras un hijo con otro.

translation.en: You're not serious?
-Why not? -Why not? Because…
Because we're married.
I married you, Clifford.
Why would you even suggest such a thing?
You've told me how much you'd love a child.
translation.es: Me dijiste que anhelabas tener un hijo.

translation.en: This way, you could have one to dote on, to fill your days.
translation.es: Tendrías a quien consentir, ocuparía tus días.

translation.en: As far as anyone else knows, I might still be capable of fathering a child.
translation.es: Para los demás, aún soy capaz de engendrar.

translation.en: If we raised him here at Wragby, he'd be ours.
translation.es: Si lo criáramos aquí, sería nuestro.

translation.en: Do you really mean this?
Well, of course, I wouldn't want you to yield yourself completely to him,
translation.es: No me gustaría que te entregaras por completo a él,

translation.en: but the mechanical act of sex is nothing when compared to a life lived together.
translation.es: pero el acto sexual mecánico no se compara con una vida juntos.

translation.en: If you govern your emotions accordingly,
we could arrange this like a trip to the dentist.
translation.es: podría ser como ir al dentista.

translation.en: A trip to the… [scoffs]
And you wouldn't mind what man's child I had?
translation.es: ¿Y no te importaría de quién fuera hijo?

translation.en: I trust your judgment. You wouldn't let the wrong sort of fellow touch you.
translation.es: Confío en tu criterio. Jamás estarías con la persona equivocada.

translation.en: Someone of the utmost discretion. The Chatterley name depends on it.
translation.es: Alguien discreto. Está en juego el nombre Chatterley.

translation.en: Would you expect me to tell you who this man was?
Best I don't know.
An heir really means this much to you?
It means a lot to the people here.
I know you can do it for them and for the Chatterleys.
translation.es: Sé que puedes hacerlo por ellos y los Chatterley.

translation.en: You do agree with me, don't you?
I'm going ahead.
Okay.
They're all talking about your book in London. It's good work.
translation.es: Todos hablan de su libro en Londres. Es una buena obra.

translation.en: You really think so?
I wanted to write something special.
Not just popular, but something really first class.
translation.es: No solo popular, sino algo de excelencia.

translation.en: The entire pals collective across the entire northeast,
keeping them together, making sure they've got all of--
translation.es: los mantienen unidos y se aseguran de que tengan…

translation.en: So sorry. Will you excuse me? Just for a second?
Uh, yes. Um…
You imagine they've solved the world's problems yet?
translation.es: ¿Cree que aquí resuelven los problemas del mundo?

translation.en: [chuckles] I'm sure they think they have.
translation.es: Estoy segura de que ellos sí.

translation.en: Shame they've forgotten their solutions by daybreak.
translation.es: Lástima que olviden las soluciones al amanecer.

translation.en: You're a writer. Maybe you should take notes.
I doubt I'd be welcome in that drinking circle.
translation.es: Dudo que sea bienvenido en la charla.

translation.en: Don't worry. I'm not really a part of this world, either.
translation.es: Descuide. Tampoco pertenezco a ese mundo.

translation.en: -Oh, but you grew up in it, didn't you? -Hardly. My father's an artist.
translation.es: - Pero se crio en él. - Para nada. Mi padre es artista.

translation.en: So I grew up between rented villas
and woke up each morning to the smell of turpentine.
translation.es: y el olor a aguarrás me despertaba por las mañanas.

translation.en: Sounds like quite the Bohemian lifestyle.
There must be days when you don't feel like a lady at all.
translation.es: Seguramente habrá días en los que no se sienta como una lady.

translation.en: I head back home in the morning. With luck, he'd invite me to visit again.
translation.es: Parto por la mañana. Con suerte, él me invitará de nuevo.

translation.en: That's the last time we'll invite the Irish playwright.
translation.es: No volveré a invitar al dramaturgo irlandés.

translation.en: -Michaelis? -Hmm.
He writes well, he knows how to dress,
but he's got the manners of a Dublin street rat.
translation.es: pero sus modales son de rata de Dublín.

translation.en: Maybe because he knows he's only around as long as people deem him useful.
translation.es: Será porque sabe que solo está aquí mientras lo consideren útil.

translation.en: We all know where we stand.
You ought to eat something. You're wasting away.
-I'm not feeling well. -Hmm? Mmm.
I haven't been feeling well since our conversation.
translation.es: Me he sentido así desde nuestra charla.

translation.en: [Clifford chuckles] Here we are, look!
I got my picture in the paper.

translation.en: [clears throat] Hmm. Chatterley's novella has garnered attention
for its humorous analysis of people and their motives,
translation.es: por el cómico análisis de la motivación humana,

translation.en: though his views on modern society are not young and playful,
translation.es: aunque su visión de la sociedad actual no es fresca ni divertida,

translation.en: but curiously old and obscenely conceited."
-Clifford, stop reading. -"A wonderful display of nothingness."
translation.es: - Deja de leer. - "Un maravilloso despliegue de nada".

translation.en: It's just one review.
But they're right.
They… they've seen right through me.
It's all nothing.
A home, love, sex, marriage, friendship, all of it.
translation.es: Hogar, amor, sexo, matrimonio, amistad, todo.

translation.en: You don't mean that.
I think I do.
I do. The whole point of living
translation.es: Hablo en serio. Vivimos para aprender a aceptar la gran nada de la vida.

translation.en: is learning to accept the great nothingness of life.
translation.es: Vivimos para aprender a aceptar la gran nada de la vida.

translation.en: I'm going to get dressed.
-[door opens] -[Hilda] Connie. Connie, it's me.
[gasps] Oh my God, you came.
-[Hilda] What's wrong? -I…
-What's wrong? -[crying]
Tell me what's wrong.
-What on earth are you doing? -[sniffles]
What's this?
I just… I wanted a change and…
You're ill.
-No, I'm fine. -Has no one been looking after you?
translation.es: - No, estoy bien. - ¿Nadie te cuida aquí?

translation.en: Um, they have.

I'm so tired.
It's okay.

Connie's not well, Clifford.
You think?
She's exhausted. Look how thin she's gotten.
I'm afraid it doesn't suit her to be a half-virgin.

translation.en: I'll look into it.
No. I'll take her to a doctor we trust.

translation.en: In the meantime,
you must hire someone to take care of you personally.

translation.es: con todo lo que sufrió, y para usted.

translation.en: You think your know how life will be, and suddenly it's gone.

This.

translation.es: por las noches y pienso: "No está conmigo en la cama".

translation.en: [Connie] Oh, it's just the touch of him.
Aye.
It's amazing, isn't it?
How someone can get so into your blood.
[Mrs. Bolton] Oh, it is.
It can make you bitter.
If it hadn't been for that pit, Ted'd still be here.
translation.es: Si no fuera por la mina, Ted seguiría aquí.

translation.en: He hated it down there.
He hated it, but what could he do? He was trapped.
I suppose we all are in different ways.
You never wanted to remarry? -Oh, Lord. -[both chuckle]
Ted was the only one? He was.
But you and your man, you know, you grow together.
translation.es: Pero un hombre y una mujer crecen juntos.

translation.en: Who else is there in life?
Children, of course, but… Oh.
-I'm sorry, that was thoughtless of me. -No.
Don't worry. It's fine.
More than fine, actually.
There still might be some hope in that regard.
-For you and Sir Clifford? -Hmm.
Doctor says his recovery is remarkable.
translation.es: Según el médico, su mejoría es notable.

translation.en: So who knows?
I might have a child yet.
Well, I hope and pray that you do.
translation.es: Espero y rezo para que así sea.

translation.en: Can I get you a blanket?
No, I'm fine, thank you.
Sleep well. Save some secrets for our next conversation.
translation.es: Que descanse. Guarde algo para la próxima charla.

translation.en: Good night.
[inhales deeply] Come on now, you lass.
I think we're best off outside.
Come on.
-[groaning] -[Mrs. Bolton] There, there.
Has Her Ladyship not risen yet?
-She got up before I did. -Hmm.
She's already had her breakfast, then.
Yes. She's out on one of her walks.
translation.es: Sí. Salió a dar uno de sus paseos.

translation.en: I was up early myself.
There were a lot of people out this morn. [breathing heavily]
-The gamekeeper, he was-- -Could you get me some fresh cream?
-Yes, sir. -Thank you.
-[water splashing] -[woman 1] Since Sir Clifford took over, they've been working the poor miners to the bone.
translation.es: Con sir Clifford al mando, los pobres mineros se desloman trabajando.

translation.en: I thought the machines were supposed to make the work easier.
translation.es: Creí que las máquinas aliviarían el trabajo.

translation.en: It's a way to make more money with fewer workers.
translation.es: Es para ganar más con menos trabajadores.

translation.en: [woman 2] Don't he have enough money already?
Oh, bet his lady needs her baubles and silk
so she can lord her station over the rest of us.
No, she's not like that.
She treats folks who work with her
with the same respect she'd treat a lord or lady.
translation.es: con igual respeto que a un lord o una lady.

translation.en: My Lily says the same about her.
Well, she deserves better then.
Such a hard lot that's fallen to her.
Oh! As it happens, uh, Sir Clifford may not be quite as done in as we thought.
translation.es: En realidad, sir Clifford quizá no esté tan maltrecho como pensábamos.

translation.en: Oh, his legs won't work again, but, you know, rest might.
translation.es: Sus piernas no volverán a funcionar, pero el resto quizá sí.

translation.en: Her Ladyship has even suggested there might be a child one day soon.
translation.es: La señora incluso sugirió que un día de estos podría nacer un hijo.

translation.en: What?
-No! -[chuckling]
-That's amazing. -You ever heard of such a thing?
[Clifford] How long should these things last?
[Mr. Linley] If we keep them in good repair, for generations.
translation.es: Bien mantenidos, deberían durar varias generaciones.

translation.en: Speaking of which, sir, if you don't mind my asking,
translation.es: Hablando de eso, sir, si no le molesta que pregunte,

translation.en: is there any truth to the rumor
translation.es: ¿qué hay de cierto en el rumor

translation.en: that we may still have hope of an heir at Wragby?
translation.es: de un posible heredero para Wragby?

translation.en: Are there rumors?
Yes.
Everyone's been asking me what I know about it.
translation.es: Todos me preguntan si sé algo.

translation.en: I am happy to set the record straight if the rumor's unfounded.
translation.es: Me gustaría aclarar las cosas si el rumor es infundado.

translation.en: Indeed.
Well…
there may yet be hope.
Hello, Con.
I've just had
the most interesting meeting with Mr. Linley.
Have you heard the rumor
that you are to supply Wragby with an heir?
translation.es: de que nos darás un heredero?

translation.en: Is it a joke?
I'd hoped it might be a prophecy.
I received a letter from Father.
translation.es: Recibí una carta de mi padre.

translation.en: He's been invited to Venice for July and August
translation.es: Lo invitaron a Venecia para julio y agosto,

translation.en: and has asked me and Hilda to come with him.
translation.es: y nos pidió a Hilda y a mí que lo acompañemos.

translation.en: July and August?
I wouldn't need to go for that long.
Three weeks should be more than enough time
for what we discussed.
Have plans already been set in motion?
Not just yet.
If I were absolutely certain you'd want to come back to me?
Of course I would.
I don't want to know his name.
No one can.
Well, in that case, I think it ought to be all right, don't you?
translation.es: En ese caso, creo que no habrá problema, ¿no?

translation.en: [Connie] You know how much you mean to me, don't you?
And you to me.
I have to go away for a while.
-Where? -Venice.
With Sir Clifford?
-For how long? -Just a couple of months.
But no, not with Clifford.
He doesn't like to travel how he is.
translation.es: No le gusta viajar en su condición.

translation.en: Aye. The poor devil.
-You won't forget about me. -Forget?
-Mm-hmm. -You know nobody forgets.
It's not a question of memory.
Look, um…
I told Clifford I might have a child.
translation.es: Le dije a Clifford que quizá tenga un hijo.

translation.en: You did?
I… I think I'm already… expecting.
Oliver?
What did he say?
He said he'd be glad
as long as the child seemed to be his.
So where does Sir Clifford suppose that this child is coming from?
translation.es: ¿De dónde supone sir Clifford que vendrá ese niño?

translation.en: -I said I might have an affair in Venice. -You might. So that's why you're going.
translation.es: - De una presunta aventura en Venecia. - Aventura. Por eso te vas.

translation.en: Not to have the affair. Just the appearance of one.
translation.es: No tendré ninguna aventura. Fingiré tenerla.

translation.en: So that's why you wanted me then.
To get a child.
Of course not, Oliver.
I never planned on you. I never planned on any of this, really.
translation.es: Nunca planeé eso contigo, en serio.

translation.en: What was the plan then, Connie?
What was the plan, really?
-What was the plan? -I--
-I don't know. -You don't know?
translation.es: - No lo sé. - ¿Tú no lo sabes?

translation.en: Well, then, I am damned if I do.
translation.es: Que me parta un rayo si lo sé yo.

translation.en: Fucking hell.
Well, it's as Your Ladyship likes.
If you get a child, Sir Clifford's welcome to it.
translation.es: Si tienes un hijo, mejor para sir Clifford.

translation.en: I shan't have lost anything.
On the contrary, I've had a nice experience.
translation.es: Al contrario, fue una gran experiencia.

translation.en: -Don't talk like that. -If you've made use of me,
translation.es: No hables así. Si me usaste,

translation.en: it's not the first time I've been made use of, is it?
translation.es: no es la primera vez que lo hacen.

translation.en: I don't suppose it's ever been as pleasant as this time.
translation.es: Jamás fue tan placentero como esta vez.

translation.en: Of course, one can't feel tremendously dignified about it.
translation.es: Claro, no es algo que te haga sentir muy digno.

translation.en: I didn't make use of you… Oliver.
As Your Ladyship pleases.
-You forgot your book. -[door slams]
Or have you made use of that as well?
With the new generators, we'll be able to reduce the workforce.
translation.es: Con los generadores nuevos, reduciremos el personal.

translation.en: -Striking will be impossible. -What about the workers?
No man's forced to work for me. I'm not forced to hire them.
translation.es: Nadie nos obliga a trabajar juntos.

translation.en: -No wonder the men hate you. -They don't hate me.
translation.es: - Con razón los hombres te odian. - No me odian.

translation.en: They depend on me. They should be grateful.
They'd starve without someone to tend them.
translation.es: Morirían de hambre si no los cuidaran.

translation.en: You talk about them as if they're herd animals.
Not all of them.
An individual may rise from the pack now and again.
translation.es: A veces se diferencia uno de la manada.

translation.en: Most of those men have been ruled since time began.
translation.es: La mayoría de ellos siempre fue gobernada.

translation.en: And you can rule them?
Yes, because I've been brought up and trained to do so.
translation.es: Sí, porque fui educado y entrenado para eso.

translation.en: That's my role in society, as it's their place to serve.
translation.es: Es mi rol social, el de ellos es servir.

translation.en: So there is no shared humanity between us?
We all need to eat and breathe, but beyond that, no.
translation.es: Todos comemos y respiramos. Otra cosa no.

translation.en: Shall we go as far as the spring?
Good day to you, Mr. Mellors!
-[horn honking] -Ayuh.
Wait, Clifford. I'll push.
What's the use of the thing if she needs to be pushed?
translation.es: ¿De qué sirve esta cosa si hay que empujarla?

translation.en: -[grunts] You're making it worse! -Be quiet a moment, will you?
Damn thing!
-[grunts] -Wait, stop!
-[horn honks] -Mellors.
-Yes, Sir Clifford? -Know anything about blasted motors?
-I'm afraid not. Has she gone wrong? -Apparently!
translation.es: - Me temo que no. ¿Se averió? - ¡Al parecer!

translation.en: Just have a look and see that nothing's broken.
translation.es: Solo fíjese si hay algo roto.

translation.en: No.
Seems all right as far as I can see, sir.
translation.es: Creo que todo está bien, sir.

translation.en: [Clifford] Then stand back.
-Maybe if I give it a push. -No. She'll do it herself.
translation.es: - Quizá sirva un empujón. - No. Lo hará sola.

translation.en: Yeah?
-You see? Good. -[engine straining]
Are you pushing? I asked you not.
-It won't go if I don't. -Give it a chance, man!
translation.es: - Si no, no anda. - ¡Dele una oportunidad!

translation.en: Clifford, watch your brake.
-Right. Fine. -Clifford!
It's obvious I'm at everybody's bloody mercy.
translation.es: Obviamente estoy a merced de todos.

translation.en: It would seem, Mr. Mellors, that she would need to be pushed.
translation.es: Parece, señor Mellors, que sería necesario empujarla.

translation.en: Do you mind? -Not at all, sir. -Hmm.
Right.
-Hang on, hang on. -[grunts]
-Two, three. -[engine starts]
Bombs away.
-[Oliver grunts] -There we are.
For God's sake, man, what's the matter with you?
Lungs are a bit knackered, sir. [coughs] Little souvenir from the war.
translation.es: Tengo los pulmones mal, sir. Un recuerdo de la guerra.

translation.en: [Clifford] What the hell are you doing?
-He needs my help, Clifford! -[Clifford] God's sake.
You all right?
[Clifford] I suppose the other chair will need a new set of wheels.
translation.es: Creo que la otra silla necesita ruedas nuevas.

translation.en: [Connie] Who do you think you are?
I mean, how can you treat someone like that?
[Clifford scoffs] Who? The gamekeeper?
He was injured in the war as well.
I mean, if he was in that chair, what would you have done to him?
translation.es: Si él estuviera en esa silla, ¿qué le habrías hecho?

translation.en: I find your comparison in very bad taste.
translation.es: Tu comparación me parece de muy mal gusto.

translation.en: I find your lack of common sympathy to be in the worst taste imaginable.
translation.es: Tu falta de compasión me parece mucho peor.

translation.en: You and your ruling class.
I thought you were different, but you're not.
translation.es: Te creí distinto, pero no lo eres.

translation.en: You make people work for £2 a week or starve.
translation.es: Que trabajen por monedas, o se mueran de hambre.

translation.en: It's not ruling, Clifford.
That's bullying.
Come on in, then.
I'm sorry.
I'm sorry for hurting you.
I don't want you for the sake of a child… Oliver.
translation.es: No te quiero para tener un hijo, Oliver.

translation.en: I just want you.
All right?
All right.
But Clifford has to believe that I tried to keep us together.
translation.es: Pero Clifford tiene que creer que lo intenté para que sigamos juntos,

translation.en: That this was his idea,
just all gone terribly wrong.
For him to give me a divorce, for us to be together,
translation.es: Para que me dé el divorcio y estemos juntos,

translation.en: he needs to believe that.
I just want to be with you.
If that's what you want.
It's not about wanting, Connie. You know what I want.
translation.es: No se trata de querer, Connie. Sabes lo que quiero.

translation.en: I've still got to get a divorce from Bertha meself.
translation.es: Aún tengo que divorciarme de Bertha.

translation.en: What happened with Bertha?
I went off to war, she carried on with other men.
translation.es: Cuando fui a la guerra, se acostó con otros.

translation.en: And now she refuses to divorce me.
translation.es: Y ahora me niega el divorcio.

translation.en: -What about her other man? -Ned?
-Mm-hmm. -He's a big baby of a fella.
She bullies him.
They both drink, he gets sent around here to harass me for me war pension.
translation.es: Son de beber. Ella lo envía a acosarme por mi pensión de guerra.

translation.en: Aye, let's dinna fight.
[Oliver] I'm sorry.
Why don't we just leave them all behind?
Go to Australia.
Go somewhere…
Anywhere.
-The three of us? -Just our family.
No one would judge us.
Seems a wrong and bitter thing to be bringing a child into this world.
translation.es: Parece algo malo y doloroso traer un niño a este mundo.

translation.en: -You don't mean that. -I do.
-No. -No, I mean this world here.
I'm pleased for us.
I'm pleased for you to be pleased.
But when I think about around here, what man has done to man…
translation.es: Pero pienso en lo que el hombre les hizo a sus semejantes,

translation.en: …what leaders of men have done to their so-called fellow men.
translation.es: y los líderes les hicieron a sus presuntos prójimos.

translation.en: Reduced them to less than humanness.
Half corpses and they think about nowt but money.
translation.es: Casi cadáveres que solo piensan en el dinero.

translation.en: Living to make money.
But not all of us have the freedom to live life how we want.
translation.es: Pero no todos somos libres de vivir cómo queremos.

translation.en: Not all of us can do as we--
What are you doing?
[Connie] Come on!
Where is she? She's been gone for hours.
Well, I'm sure it's just the rain that's keeping her.
translation.es: Seguramente se retrasó por la lluvia.

translation.en: She's… she's probably sheltering in the hut.
-I'll send Warren and Betts to find her. -No, don't you do that.
translation.es: - Enviaré a Warren y a Betts a buscarla. - No lo haga.

translation.en: It'll only get people talking.
I'll slip over to the hut and, uh, see if she's there.
translation.es: Iré yo a ver si está en el cobertizo.

translation.en: -What? And leave me here alone? -Oh, don't you worry.
We'll be back in no time.
-Ayup. -Ayup.
-Ayup, me duck. -Ayup, me duck.
translation.es: - Ayuh, mi perra. - Ayuh, mi perra.

translation.en: I leave for Venice on Thursday.
I'll come by the cottage that night.
translation.es: Iré a la cabaña esa noche.

translation.en: [Mrs. Bolton] Milady?
Oh, milady, there you are.
Sir Clifford asked me to look for you. He was worried something had happened.
translation.es: Me envió sir Clifford. Él temía que le hubiera pasado algo.

translation.en: No. No, I was sheltering in the hut from the rain.
translation.es: No. Me refugié de la lluvia en el cobertizo.

translation.en: Mrs. Bolton.
Your Ladyship would be quite all right from here.
translation.es: La señora puede seguir sola desde aquí.

translation.en: Good evening to you. Good evening to you, Your Ladyship.
I am not a child. It's monstrous that I have to be followed.
translation.es: No soy una niña. Es monstruoso que me sigan.

translation.en: My Ladyship, don't say that.
Sir Clifford was sure you'd been struck by lightning.
translation.es: Sir Clifford creía que le había caído un rayo.

translation.en: It's not your fault. It's foolish of Clifford to worry.
translation.es: No es su culpa. Es absurdo que él se preocupe.

translation.en: Well, let's go home now.
And I'll take care of the rest.
translation.es: Y yo me ocupo de lo demás.

translation.en: You don't need to send the servants out after me.
translation.es: No hace falta que me hagas buscar.

translation.en: [Clifford] God, where have you been?
You've been gone out hours, and in a storm like this.
translation.es: Saliste hace horas, y con esta tormenta.

translation.en: What have you been doing?
translation.es: - ¿Qué estuviste haciendo? - ¿Y si no te digo?

translation.en: What if I choose not to tell you? I went to the hut and lit a fire.
translation.es: - ¿Qué estuviste haciendo? - ¿Y si no te digo? Estuve en el cobertizo.

translation.en: -Look at you. The state of your hair. -I went out into the rain… naked.
translation.es: - Mírate. Cómo tienes el cabello. - Estuve bajo la lluvia… desnuda.

translation.en: [sputtering] Are you mad?
Suppose Mellors had seen you while you were prancing with nothing on.
translation.es: Mira si Mellors te veía pavoneándote en cueros.

translation.en: Yes… suppose he had.
You're right, Clifford. I should really go and get cleaned up.
translation.es: Tienes razón, Clifford. Debería ir a asearme.

translation.en: [Clifford] Connie!
[Connie] My sister's here!
-[Hilda] It's so good to see you. -It's been too long.
[Hilda] Good to see you.
[Connie] You know I've met someone, don't you?
I gathered from your letters, yes.
translation.es: Lo deduje de tus cartas, sí.

translation.en: I tried to tell myself it was nothing. I tried to stay away. I did.
translation.es: Traté de convencerme de que no era nada y alejarme.

translation.en: But I can't.
He…
I really love him.
-Wow. -And-- I know.
And I said I would stay with him tonight. I promised.
translation.es: Le prometí que pasaría esta noche con él.

translation.en: Are you going to tell me who he is?
He's our gamekeeper.
[hesitates] No, Hilda. He's lovely.
Honestly, he has such an understanding and tenderness.
translation.es: De verdad, es muy comprensivo y tierno.

translation.en: He's quite the exception, you'll see.
I long hoped you would find someone else.
translation.es: Deseaba mucho que hallaras a alguien.

translation.en: -But one of Clifford's servants? -I'm not giving him up!
translation.es: - Pero ¿un criado de Clifford? - ¡No lo dejaré!

translation.en: [scoffs] Listen to you. It's you and that German boy all over again.
translation.es: Escucha lo que dices. Es igual que con el chico alemán.

translation.en: -It's not, Hilda! It's nothing like that! -Yes, it is!
translation.es: - ¡No es así! ¡Nada que ver! - ¡Sí que lo es!

translation.en: Confusing sex with love, and then thinking it can continue
translation.es: Confundes sexo con amor, y luego decides seguir

translation.en: just because it's what you want.
Please, come to Venice and take the time to think through what you really want.
translation.es: Ven a Venecia y reflexiona sobre lo que realmente quieres.

translation.en: I know what I want!
-Really? -Yes!
And I'm seeing him tonight or I'm not going to Venice. I can't!
translation.es: Y lo veré esta noche o no iré a Venecia. ¡No puedo!

translation.en: I really thought that you, of all people, would understand!
translation.es: ¡Creí que tú más que nadie lo entendería!

translation.en: Goodbye.
-Bye. -I look forward to your letters.
You have a good time, and then come back and cheer us up.
I will. Take care.
This is my sister, Hilda.
-[Oliver] Hello. -Hilda, this is Oliver Mellors.
translation.es: - Hola. - Hilda, te presento a Oliver Mellors.

translation.en: -Hello. -Pleasure to meet you.
Take a seat then.
[Connie] Hilda.
What do you want me to say?
Whatever it is you're thinking.
Very well.
It is one thing to hold trysts in your cottage,
translation.es: Una cosa son los encuentros en su cabaña,

translation.en: but what happens when you go out into the world?
translation.es: pero ¿qué pasará cuando salgan al mundo?

translation.en: When Connie's friends cross the street to avoid her.
translation.es: Cuando la eviten los amigos en la calle.

translation.en: That's not fair.
She's got me figured out, then, eh?
What summed me up so quick? Were it summat I said?
translation.es: ¿Cómo me descubrió tan rápido? ¿Fue algo que dije?

translation.en: Mr. Mellors.
How do you expect to take care of her once you've lost your job?
translation.es: ¿Cómo piensa cuidarla cuando pierda el trabajo?

translation.en: Do you actually believe you can give her a chance at happiness?
translation.es: ¿En serio cree que puede hacerla feliz?

translation.en: Oh, you're asking the wrong person there.
translation.es: Le pregunta a la persona errónea.

translation.en: All I know is I get a great deal of happiness from her.
translation.es: Yo solo sé que ella me hace muy feliz.

translation.en: -Thought of your own happiness at least. -Hilda, enough!
translation.es: - Al menos pensó en su propia felicidad. - ¡Ya basta!

translation.en: I think you understand far better than she does
translation.es: Creo que comprende mucho mejor que ella

translation.en: how badly this could end, Mr. Mellors.
translation.es: lo mal que puede terminar esto.

translation.en: Think about how much she really means to you.
translation.es: Piense en lo que significa para usted.

translation.en: I'll pick you up in the morning, Connie. Early.
translation.es: Vendré por ti mañana, Connie. Temprano.

translation.en: Don't keep me waiting.
-Mr. Mellors. -[Connie] Hilda.
I'm so sorry. I shouldn't have brought her.
Please don't let her upset you.
She's just protective.
She's right.
We haven't thought beyond tomorrow, have we?
translation.es: No pensamos en lo que viene después.

translation.en: Sir Clifford will fight this divorce.
translation.es: Sir Clifford te negará el divorcio.

translation.en: He'll fight to keep our child.
I never had to think about these things until you turned up.
translation.es: Jamás tuve que pensar en cosas así antes de conocerte.

translation.en: Let's go upstairs.
Yeah, that's good. That's good.
-[gasping, moaning] -Yes.
The fuck are you playing at, Ned?
Calm down, Mellors. I'm not here to fight. Bertha sent me.
translation.es: Tranquilízate, Mellors. No vine a pelear. Me envía Bertha.

translation.en: She's your problem now.
Not mine.
Ain't how she sees it.
She's still your wife, entitled to half your military pension.
translation.es: Siguen casados, tiene derecho a la mitad de tu pensión.

translation.en: Aye, and I'm entitled to a divorce. I won't get one, will I?
translation.es: Y yo tengo derecho al divorcio. No me lo dará, ¿no?

translation.en: -Fuck off, then. -[Flossie growling]
translation.es: Así que vete a la mierda.

translation.en: -All right. I'm going. -[Flossie barks]
[Ned] I'm going.
[Connie] Is he gone?
Unless his heart's just given out running.
translation.es: Esperemos a que se vaya el caballo.

translation.en: Stay there till we know he's gone.
-[car horn honks] -Oh, what is she thinking?
Go on.
[Hilda] Connie.
For heaven's sake, Connie.
translation.es: Por el amor de Dios, Connie.

translation.en: We're going to Venice tomorrow. Do you have to look so miserable?
translation.es: Mañana nos vamos a Venecia. ¿Tienes que estar tan triste?

translation.en: I think I'm pregnant.
Right.
I assume it's not Clifford's.
translation.es: Y no debe ser de Clifford.

translation.en: Although, he did say he would be happy for me to have a child with another man.
translation.es: Aunque me dijo que le gustaría que tuviera un hijo con otro hombre.

translation.en: -Seriously? -Mm-hmm.
I don't know how much longer I can do this. It's all right.
translation.es: - No sé cuánto más podré hacer esto. - Tranquila.

translation.en: What exactly?
What's happened?
I'm in love with someone
other than Clifford.
So you've taken a lover?
Well, good.
Do I know the man?
[scoffs] No.
But I think I… want a divorce from Clifford.
[Sir Malcolm] Because of your feelings for this other man?
translation.es: Por lo que sientes por este hombre.

translation.en: Well, if you want my opinion… [sighs]
I'm sorry, but you stand to gain very little by breaking things off.
translation.es: perdón, pero no te beneficias mucho divorciándote.

translation.en: Feelings come and go.
You may love one man this year and another the next,
translation.es: Amas a alguien ahora, luego a otro,

translation.en: but the world will go on.
And Wragby will go on standing.
Please yourself,
but stick by Wragby.
And Wragby will stick by you.
translation.es: Y Wragby no te dejará a ti.

translation.en: Let's go to Venice, shall we?
[Ned] He comes back home thinking he's better than the lot of us.
translation.es: Vuelve de la guerra y se cree mejor que nosotros.

translation.en: Gets the world to think poor Bertha's to blame for all their trouble,
translation.es: Culpa de sus problemas a la pobre Bertha frente a todos,

translation.en: and then he refuses to support her.
-[man] Bloody disgrace. -I know.
Bertha goes to the cottage today, trying to patch things up.
translation.es: Bertha fue a la cabaña hoy para arreglar las cosas.

translation.en: Makes sense.
She found them silk nightclothes in the fire.
translation.es: Encontró un camisón en el fuego.

translation.en: No wonder he keeps to himself. He's hiding a woman in there.
translation.es: Por eso es tan reservado. Oculta a una mujer.

translation.en: Lady Chatterley loans her gamekeeper a book,
translation.es: Lady Chatterley le presta un libro,

translation.en: and she's accused of… Sorry, that's outrageous.
translation.es: y la acusan de… Perdón, es indignante.

translation.en: [woman] Of course it is. I won't breathe another word on the subject.
translation.es: Claro. No hablaré más del tema.

translation.en: [woman 2] Everyone's talking about it. You know how people gossip.
translation.es: Está en boca de todos. Saben cómo son.

translation.en: Sir, no one wants to have this conversation,
but we must.
[Linley] And of course, it's pure nonsense.
But your gamekeeper seems to inspire all manner of rumors.
translation.es: Pero su guardabosque suscita todo tipo de rumores.

translation.en: The sooner you pack him off, the better.
translation.es: Cuanto antes se deshaga de él, mejor.

translation.en: [Clifford] I appreciate you coming to me with this. Your concerns are noted.
translation.es: Le agradezco que me lo contara, Linley. Lo tendré en cuenta.

translation.en: Hello… [hesitates]
I'd like a London number, please.
Lady Chatterley.
-Ayuh, Mrs. Bolton. -Good day.
I hear Sir Clifford's asking for me.
Of course, yes. He's in his study.
translation.es: Claro, sí. Está en su estudio.

translation.en: Right, aye.
Mr. Mellors.
I called Her Ladyship, and she's coming back.
translation.es: Llamé a la señora, está de regreso.

translation.en: -When? -This evening.
As soon as she can get here.
She said you could meet at the hut and decide what to do.
translation.es: Lo verá en el cobertizo para decidir qué hacer.

translation.en: There's…
There's dark days coming, Mrs. Bolton.
translation.es: Se aproximan días oscuros, señora Bolton.

translation.en: Best to steer clear from it all.
[Clifford] Come in.
You are my servant,
living upon my land at my sole discretion,
translation.es: vive en mis tierras bajo mi propio arbitrio,

translation.en: and now your indecencies have become the subject of gossip.
translation.es: y sus indecencias son ahora tema de chismes.

translation.en: You should shut the mouths of the gossips--
Are you aware that Lady Chatterley's name has been slandered?
Apparently, her name was inscribed in a book found at the cottage.
translation.es: Su nombre estaba escrito en un libro de la cabaña.

translation.en: I've got a picture of Queen Mary on me wall calendar.
translation.es: Tengo una foto de la reina María.

translation.en: I suppose she's in my harem as well.
translation.es: Seguro también es de mi harén.

translation.en: I do not appreciate your sarcasm, Mellors.
translation.es: No me agrada su sarcasmo, Mellors.

translation.en: You have until the end of today,
translation.es: Tiene hasta el fin del día,

translation.en: after which time I never want to see you set foot upon my land again.
translation.es: luego, no quiero que vuelva a pisar mis tierras.

translation.en: -Do I make myself clear? -Oh, perfectly.
I better get packing then.
Mrs. Flint. Mrs. Flint, excuse me.
-I have to get Josephine to bed. -I know you've heard things.
translation.es: - Debo acostar a mi hija. - Sé lo que oyó.

translation.en: Please, I can't do this. We lease this farm from Sir Clifford.
translation.es: Por favor. No puedo. Le arrendamos a sir Clifford.

translation.en: And you always will.
You met him here, didn't you? The day he came to get milk?
translation.es: Lo conoció aquí, ¿no? Cuando vino a buscar leche.

translation.en: -I thought you'd come to see us. -Of course I did.
translation.es: - Creí que venía a vernos. - Y fue así.

translation.en: I found where you parked the car in the trees.
translation.es: Vi dónde estacionaron en el bosque.

translation.en: -No, that was one time. -I don't want to know.
translation.es: - Eso fue una sola vez. - No quiero saberlo.

translation.en: Good evening, Lady Chatterley.
[Connie] What are you doing? Where are you going?
The cat is well and truly out of the bag now, Connie.
translation.es: Nuestro secreto salió a la luz.

translation.en: Everybody's talking.
I've been sacked.
You cannot be seen here, Connie. You need to be in Venice.
translation.es: No pueden verte aquí, Connie. Debes irte a Venecia.

translation.en: -But we could just leave together. Now. -Look at me.
translation.es: - Podemos irnos juntos. Ya mismo. - Mírame.

translation.en: I have nothing to give you.
I've no job. I've no home. I've no purpose in life. Nothing.
translation.es: No tengo trabajo, hogar, propósito en la vida, nada.

translation.en: Don't say that.
You are everything to me.
[man] Mellors!
You need to go!
-Look at me. -Shh.
Promise me, promise me we'll share our lives.
-Aye. -Promise.
Aye, me lass.
When the time comes. When the time comes.
-[man] Mellors! -[Oliver] Oh…
Ayuh, can I grab me coat, mate, or…
I'll find you.
Wherever you are, I'll find you.
-My Ladyship, you shouldn't be here. -No, Mrs. Bolton.
translation.es: - No debería estar aquí. - No, señora Bolton.

translation.en: [Clifford] Connie.
It's all true.
Why would you do this?
-It was your idea. -My idea? No, no, no.
Clifford, you knew perfectly well what I was getting into.
translation.es: Sabías perfectamente en lo que me metía.

translation.en: With the right sort of man. I said the right sort!
Oliver Mellors is a better person than anyone I've ever met.
translation.es: Oliver Mellors es la mejor persona que conocí en mi vida.

translation.en: I was perfectly clear, Connie.
-We discussed the rules. -I'm going to have his child.
You're going to--
You're sure?
But… everybody knows.
translation.es: Pero… lo sabe todo el mundo.

translation.en: You can't possibly expect me to claim that child as mine now.
translation.es: No esperes que lo reclame como mío.

translation.en: No, I…
I don't. I don't.
I want a divorce, Clifford.
I'm leaving you.
No. No, you can't.
Look, I'm… I'm so sorry about how this has all turned out,
translation.es: Lamento mucho que todo terminara así,

translation.en: but we both know that this… marriage
translation.es: pero ambos sabemos que hace tiempo

translation.en: has been very unhappy for a very long time now.
It hasn't been. It hasn't been. Not for me.
translation.es: No lo es. No para mí.

translation.en: Well, yes.
Because you laid out all the rules.
And I tried to follow them.
I tried to support you in every way I could.
translation.es: Intenté apoyarte en todo lo que pude.

translation.en: [voice shaking] But you gave me nothing in return.
translation.es: Pero no me diste nada a cambio.

translation.en: Not the slightest drop of affection or kindness.
translation.es: Ni la más mínima muestra de cariño o bondad.

translation.en: And what's worse, you made me feel ashamed for even wanting those things.
translation.es: Y peor aún, hiciste que me avergonzara por querer esas cosas.

translation.en: I've always cared for you, Connie.
translation.es: Siempre me preocupé por ti, Connie.

translation.en: Yes, cared for me.
In the same way you care for your books and for your radio,
translation.es: Como te preocupas por tus libros y tu radio,

translation.en: but never in the ways I need you to.
translation.es: pero nunca como necesito que lo hagas.

translation.en: [Clifford] I love you, Connie.
I've loved you the only way I know how.
translation.es: Te he amado del único modo que sé.

translation.en: I've given you everything I know how to give.
translation.es: Te he dado todo lo que supe dar.

translation.en: It's not enough.
Then talk to me, Con.
Help me understand.
Show me how I can prove to you how I feel.
translation.es: Dime cómo puedo demostrarte lo que siento.

translation.en: Let me go.
Please.
Let me go.
Go.
Though know this.
I will never grant you your divorce.
Because you broke your word.
Because you've made a mockery of my life here in Wragby.
translation.es: Me pusiste en ridículo aquí en Wragby.

translation.en: I am not inclined to give you anything ever again.
translation.es: No estoy dispuesto a darte nada más.

translation.en: I don't think you ever really were.
I wasn't meaning to pry, but I worried about you.
translation.es: Perdón, pero estaba preocupada por usted.

translation.en: I'm all right. [sighs]
Listen.
You have no idea where Mellors has gone?
Would you ask your friends to let you know if they hear any news?
translation.es: ¿Le pediría a sus amigos que le avisen si se enteran de algo?

translation.en: And why shall I say I'm asking?
translation.es: ¿Por qué les diré que lo hago?

translation.en: Because I love him.
-Tell them that. -Yes, milady.
I do hope you find your gentleman.
translation.es: Espero que encuentre a su hombre.

translation.en: Thank you, Mrs. Bolton.
So do I.
[woman 1] It's all true, then?
Has Her Ladyship left Sir Clifford?
Her Ladyship has asked
that you will pass along any news of Mr. Mellors.
translation.es: que difundan cualquier noticia del Sr. Mellors.

translation.en: "'Cause I love him," she said.
She gave up everything for him.
Her title, her wealth, her position in the world.
translation.es: A su título, a su riqueza, a su posición en el mundo.

translation.en: Now she's lost him.
I'll not hear a word spoken against them.
translation.es: No quiero que hablen mal de ellos.

translation.en: This is a love story.
This place is losing its charm, don't you think?
What?
Let's go back to London.
All right.
I'm Connie Reid. I don't think we met.
translation.es: Soy Connie Reid. No nos presentaron.

translation.en: Have a lovely evening.
How many times have you read that page?
What?
Well… it looks as though he's found you.
-Oh my God. -Yes.
You'll want my car again, I imagine.
[Oliver] You'll be impressed to learn that word of your departure from Wragby
translation.es: Te sorprenderá que la noticia de tu partida de Wragby

translation.en: has made it all the way to my little village in Scotland.
translation.es: haya llegado hasta este pueblito de Escocia.

translation.en: A man came to work in the local mines, brought the tale with him,
translation.es: La trajo un hombre que vino a trabajar en las minas.

translation.en: telling everyone in the pub about a lady who fell for a hired man
translation.es: Contó en el pub sobre una lady que se enamoró de un jornalero

translation.en: and didn't care if the world knew it because… she loved him.
translation.es: y no le importó que todos se enteraran porque lo amaba.

translation.en: Names weren't used, of course.
I was simply "the gamekeeper."
You were the "Lady in love."
Excuse me, I'm looking for Oliver Mellors.
Do you… Do you know him?
[man] Oh yes, I do.
He's down that road.
Thank you. Thank you so much!
[Oliver] It was a good story, and I found myself wondering
translation.es: Era una buena historia, y me pregunté

translation.en: if there might be more to the tale.
A feller I knew from the army got me work at a farm here.
translation.es: Un amigo me consiguió trabajo en una granja.

translation.en: Thirty shillings a week and decent lodgings in a cottage up the road.
translation.es: Treinta chelines a la semana y una cabaña decente calle arriba.

translation.en: I thought I needed a purpose
before bringing you and a child into my life.
translation.es: antes de traerlos a ti y al niño a mi vida.

translation.en: [Oliver] I can't say I've found any greater meaning here on the farm,
translation.es: No diré que hallé un sentido mejor aquí en la granja…

translation.en: but I've made a home.
I can't imagine what you've already been through
translation.es: No puedo imaginar por todo lo que pasaste

translation.en: and how much you've already given up.
You'd be giving up even more to come live here with me,
translation.es: Y a lo que renunciarás por mudarte aquí conmigo, pero…

translation.en: Oliver!
[Oliver] …what we have… together
is different than anything I've ever known.
translation.es: es diferente a todo lo que conocí.

translation.en: There's a little flame between us. It's always burning.
translation.es: Nos une una llama siempre ardiente.

translation.en: And I've come to believe that tending a fire like that is…
translation.es: Y creo que cuidar ese fuego

translation.en: purpose enough for any life.
translation.es: es propósito suficiente para cualquier vida.
